clinical_study.brief_title: Apoptosis May Have a Role in Etiopathogenesis of Obstetric Cholestasis.
clinical_study.official_title: Apoptosis May Have a Role in Etiopathogenesis of Obstetric Cholestasis.

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy is a disease specific to pregnancy period; especially late second and third trimester. We aimed to investigate the role of apoptosis in etiopathogenesis of obstetric cholestasis.

detailed_description.textblock: M30 (caspases cleaved Cytokeratin-18 (CK-18) fragment) is a specific apoptosis marker. We aimed to use it to evaluate the apoptotic process.

primary_outcome.measure: M30 value as Unit per Liter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of delivery with cesarean section.

arm_group.description: Pregnant subjects diagnosed with obstetric cholestasis who didn't have any foreknown systemic disease.
entirely healthy pregnant subjects, the control group.

biospec_descr.textblock: Maternal venous and umbilical cord blood.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who admitted our clinic without foreknown systemic diseases or multiple pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Late second or third trimester of pregnancy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Foreknown systemic diseases, multiple pregnancy, smoking cigarettes.
